config.entity_texture_features.allow_ill:
This setting allows you to overwrite the
Vanilla behaviour of prohibiting all
non [a-z0-9/._-] characters in texture paths.
this means textures with spaces or capitals
are allowed to be used.
Disabled by default as these problems should really
be fixed by the resource-pack creator
config.entity_texture_features.always_ch:
Most resource packs use the emissive suffix _e
however this can be overridden by packs if they
want to use a different suffix.
If this is true the mod will always check for
'_e' suffixes even when set differently by a resource pack
config.entity_texture_features.blink_fre:
sets how often textures will randomly blink
if set to 100 mobs will blink randomly after
1 second delay and then at a random time from
1 to 100 ticks (0-5 seconds)
This can be set / overridden per mob
by the resource-pack
See the mod download page for details
config.entity_texture_features.blink_len:
sets how long textures will blink for
0 = 1 tick, 19 = 20 ticks / 1 second
This can be set / overridden per mob
by the resource-pack
See the mod download page for details
config.entity_texture_features.blinking_:
Sets whether or not mobs will try to blink
The Mob must have a texture with it's eyes
closed named "textureName_blink.png".
And an optional texture with it's eyes half
closed named "textureName_blink2.png".
config.entity_texture_features.custom_bl:
Allows block entities to use a custom texture
using the optifine/ETF random format
incompatible with the enhanced block entities mod
config.entity_texture_features.debug_log:
If enabled this will write relevant ETF data
about any entity that has been right clicked
to either the log file or to in-game chat
config.entity_texture_features.elytra_th:
The thickness of Elytra is a bit larger than
the 2 pixels it is meant to be.
This option will 'fix' the scaling of the Elytra to
be more consistent.
REQUIRES a restart or reload (F3 + T)
config.entity_texture_features.emissive_:
Allows block entities to use emissive texture
incompatible with the enhanced block entities mod
config.entity_texture_features.enable_cu:
Enables Randomized entity textures
works with resource packs
Allows for entity texture customization
using the optifine format
config.entity_texture_features.enable_el:
Allows Elytra to use emissive textures
Elytras only have emissive support as the CIT mod
already handles customizing these and is fully
compatible with ETF's emissive textures.
config.entity_texture_features.enable_em:
Enables Emissive entity textures
works with resource packs
using the optifine format
config.entity_texture_features.enable_en:
Allows player skins to be enabled/disabled
for players on opposing teams in PVP games
otherwise they may be harder to see
and may affect balance
///THIS SETTING REQUIRES A RESTART\\\
config.entity_texture_features.enable_tr:
Allows tridents to use custom & emissive textures
This toggle is here to support possible future CIT mod updates
The trident item name will choose the texture file to use
The texture 'trident_bobbys_trident.png; will be chosen by the names:
'Bobby's Trident', ' BoBb%Ys   Trid##en t', & 'bobbys_trident'
The texture 'trident_bobbys_trident_e.png; will be emissive.
config.entity_texture_features.emissive_:
This sets whether emissives use 'Brighter' or 'Default' rendering
This is hard to describe, just try it out in-game :)
Bright rendering makes the emissive appear at max brightness if need be
and is only partially compatible with shaders, etc.
Default rendering respects the default renderers effects on entities,
the direction of each surface will have slight brightness variation
and the emissives will be a bit less bright overall
as well as usually smaller bloom with shaders.
Compatible mode, automatically adjusts the rendering mode for best shader compatibility & brightness
Block entities will always be on default mode unless Iris is installed.
config.entity_texture_features.hide_butt:
Hides the ETF settings button
in the resource-pack selection screen
config.entity_texture_features.ignore_wa:
This option only appears if a warning is displayed or it is enabled.
If enabled ETF will ignore and hide warnings and will no longer disable
features automatically for compatibility reasons
The amount of warnings currently being ignored is
config.entity_texture_features.player_sk:
What position on the head should blinking occur
 1 = top of head
8 = bottom of head
blinking has been enabled and slowed down

Select what kind of blinking your skin needs
for eyes of varying sizes.

Blinking must be enabled in settings!

Allows this skin to use ETF transparent skin features
otherwise forces the inner-skin to be opaque like vanilla

lets you select between using various capes:
Optifine cape, if you have one
minecraftcapes.net cape if you have one
The ETF cape
or texture your own custom cape in your skin

Choose how long the extension is
from 1 - 8

This feature provides extension options
for how minecraft renders the
'Jacket' layer of your minecraft skin
(the second layer that floats above your body)
and allows it to go up to 8 pixels further down
Typical uses could be for Jackets,
Dresses, Villager cloaks and Robes.
The texturing is extremely straight forward,
if enabled this feature will
 copy or move the contents of the top of
the Legs floating skin layers and
 use them to build the extension
you can crouch before opening the menu to see it here

Allows selecting pixels in your skin to be emissive
(glowing)
Allows selecting pixels in your skin to be enchanted

Skin file failed to save to file.
check you log for errors.
Skin file has been saved successfully.
An interactive tool to select and add
Player skin features to your skin
Upload skin changes to Minecraft profile
Skin uploaded successfully, but could not be updated in-game without restart

Allows player skins to use the features added by this mod.
Features are set in the players skin file.
 - Use the Skin Tool to select features
 - Documentation can be found on the mod page
 - This can be disabled for enemy team players for PVP
Features include:
 - Emissive pixels
 - Enchanted pixels
 - Blinking & (closed eyes when sleeping)
 - maybe more...
config.entity_texture_features.remove_pi:
ETF removes pixels underneath
 emissive textures to prevent z-fighting
with shaders.
 
Disabling these settings may:

- Cause z-fighting emissives with
  some shaders.

- Fix Iris PBR textures not working
  for mobs with emissive textures.

- Fix animated textures having missing
  pixels with animation mods.

- Break armour legging emissives when
  a chest-plate is equipped.
config.entity_texture_features.restrict_:
Restrict Biome property updates
Must enable 'Restrict some property updates' first

Restrict Block property updates
Must enable 'Restrict some property updates' first

Restrict Day Time property updates
Must enable 'Restrict some property updates' first

Restrict Height property updates
Must enable 'Restrict some property updates' first

Restrict Moon Phase property updates
Must enable 'Restrict some property updates' first

Select what texture properties
can update over time

Restrict Weather property updates
Must enable 'Restrict some property updates' first
config.entity_texture_features.skin_feat: Save a copy of your skin with the skin feature template applied

To help you setup your skin for skin features
This setting will save a copy of your skin with
the skin feature template applied onto it
to the minecraft directory.
After enabling this setting open a game, enter third person & press F3+T
you will get a message in chat telling you when it is finished

Allows player skins to be 100% transparent
WARNING: this overrides the 60% transparency check
 for player skins so they can be completely invisible
 this option only changes what you can see and will
 not make you invisible to others, it is meant for fun.
//REQUIRES RESTART\\

Allows player skins to be transparent on the base texture
the texture can only be an average of
 60% transparent to prevent abuse
- uses transparency in the skin texture itself
config.entity_texture_features.skin_sele: Click a pixel in your skin to select those colours
WARNING: you have selected too many different colours, some may not work
config.entity_texture_features.special_e:
This option is provided as these cases
may not fit into the typical users expectation of entity.
config.entity_texture_features.texture_u:
Sets how often a mobs textures will
update for changes like health & age
Never = never update
Slow = 3-5 seconds
Fast = less than a second
Instant = instant (possible lag with hundred of mobs)
config.entity_texture_features.title: Entity Texture Features
Block entity features don't apply to EBE block entities.
config.entity_texture_features.warn.figu: ETF skin features are disabled for compatibility.
config.entity_texture_features.warn.no_e: Entity Model Features(EMF) is needed if you want OptiFine format Custom Entity Models.
config.entity_texture_features.warn.quar: Quark's [Variant Animal Textures] must be disabled for ETF random textures to work.
config.entity_texture_features.warn.iris: See 'emissive fix options' if iris PBR does not work on mobs.
config.entity_texture_features.warn_conf: The ETF config file was either corrupt or could not be loaded! default settings are being used...
config.entity_texture_features.warn_inst: Some warnings disable the conflicting ETF settings, unless ignored
config.entity_texture_features.ignore_de:
If this warning / conflict
is ignored it will no longer
affect ETF settings
config.entity_texture_features.illegal_p:
ETF has detected a resource pack with a non [a-z0-9_.-] character in the file path.
This texture will be ignored by ETF unless you enable the [Allow broken texture paths] option in ETFs settings.
The Vanilla error message for the incorrect texture will now follow:
ETF has allowed a resource with a non [a-z0-9_.-] character in the file path, it is recommended you fix this file name.
config.entity_texture_features.pbr_compa:
when enabled ETF will not tamper with any
texture that has PBR textures with them
if shader mods are present.

Note: this may introduce z-fighting depending on your shader
config.entity_texture_features.animation:
when enabled ETF will not tamper with any
texture that has an animation
currently only if MoreMcmeta mod is present.

Note: this may introduce z-fighting depending on your shader
config.entity_texture_features.disable_d:
By default you can use the vanilla directory for random textures
This will allow you to disable that and enforce the optifine and etf folders usage
This is intended to support mods that have entity textures named 'mob2.png' for some reason
config.entity_texture_features.skin_feat:
this will attempt to enabled transparent skin rendering
 for ALL skins not just ETF enabled skins
 WARNING this bypasses the 100% transparency check
config.entity_texture_features.skin_laye:
You are seeing this as the 3D skin layers mod is detected.
ETF contains a patch to allow skin features to
render correctly with the excellent 3d Skin Layers mod
future changes to that mod might break this so the patch is optional

RESTART REQUIRED after changing this
config.entity_texture_features.warden.ti: Allow warden glowing textures for full model
config.entity_texture_features.warden.to:
The vanilla game only allows the wardens glowing textures like
 'warden_heart.png'
to render for the one body part it applies too
 enabling this setting will let that texture apply to the entire model
config.entity_texture_features.player_sk: The skin tool could not be enabled because:

-ETF skin features are not enabled.
 You must enable them, then close and reopen the settings to apply it.

-Fabric API was not found.
 It is required for the skin tool to work on Fabric.

-The client player data was null.
 Make sure you have a world open and
 your skin has loaded before you try to use the tool.

-ETF has not yet had the chance to parse the client players skin,
 try open a world and open third person or your inventory
 to see yourself for a few seconds first.
config.entity_texture_features.warn.iris: For an unidentified reason, 3D Skin Layers and Iris together break emissive armor trims.
config.entity_texture_features.player_sk: Settings will not update for the skin tool until this config has been saved
Hover mouse over button for help.

Select a nose type for your skin
Villager #1 uses the villager texture
Villager #2 uses your skin for the texture
 (positioned like in the villager texture)
The textured options are flat noses using
 various different locations in the skin

Tool is only usable while in-game!
Open a singleplayer world and then open this menu.

You must also give ETF a moment to download your skin.

Tool is not available in offline mode

Tool is not available with skin features disabled

If using Fabric, then  the Fabric API is also required.
config.entity_texture_features.button_to: Opens the Entity Texture Features config screen.
